text: The See-Saw is a painting by French Rococo artist Jean-Honoré Fragonard, created sometime around 1750 to 1752 during the artist's early career. It is currently in the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum in Madrid. The painting forms a pair with another Fragonard work entitled Blind Man's Bluff. The See-Saw depicts young children playing with a seesaw in a forest grove. It is seen as an important precedent to Fragonard's masterpiece The Swing. == References == == Further reading == * The Art Story * Delphi Complete Works of Jean-Honoré Fragonard (Illustrated) * 149 Paintings You Really Need to See in Europe (So You Can Ignore the Others) Category:Paintings in the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum Category:Paintings by Jean-Honoré Fragonard Category:Paintings of children Category:1750s paintings
title: The See-Saw
